message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a novel loss function for training deep learning architectures for classification tasks. This loss function involves building similarity graphs and minimizing the smoothness of label signals on these graphs. This work is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural networks (cs.NE), and natural language processing (cs.CL). However, given that the focus is on classification tasks, we believe that cs.LG and cs.CV are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.AI, cs.NE, and cs.CL.
